title: Bounding the Mim-Width of Hereditary Graph Classes

sections.algorithmic implications:
One trade-off of a more powerful width parameter is the difficulty in obtaining a branch decomposition of bounded width.
In general, computing mim-width is NP-hard; deciding if the mim-width is at mostÂ kğ‘˜k is Wdelimited-[]1-hard when parameterized by kğ‘˜k; and there is no polynomial-time algorithm for approximating the mim-width of a graph to within a constant factor of the optimal, unless ğ–­ğ–¯=ğ–¹ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¹ğ–¯ğ–¯\mathsf{NP}=\mathsf{ZPP}Â .
Hence, in contrast to algorithms for graphs of bounded treewidth or clique-width, algorithms for graphs of bounded mim-width require a branch decomposition of constant mim-width as part of the input.
On the other hand, there are many interesting graph classes for which mim-width is bounded and quickly computable, that is, the class admits a polynomial-time algorithm for obtaining a branch decomposition of constant mim-width. We give examples of such graph classes known in the literature in SectionÂ 1.2 before discussing the new graph classes we found in SectionÂ 1.4. Below we briefly discuss known algorithms for problems on graph classes of bounded mim-width. Belmonte and VatshelleÂ  and Bui-Xuan, Telle and VatshelleÂ 6 proved that a large set of problems, known as Locally Checkable Vertex Subset and Vertex Partitioning (LC-VSVP) problemsÂ , can be solved in polynomial time
for graph classes where mim-width is bounded and quickly computable.
Well-known examples of such problems include (Total) Dominating Set, Independent Set and kğ‘˜k-Colouring for every fixed positive
integerÂ kğ‘˜k.111In contrast to clique-widthÂ , Colouring (where kğ‘˜k is part of the input) is NP-complete for graphs of bounded mim-width, as it is NP-complete for circular-arc graphsÂ , which have mim-width at mostÂ 222Â .
Later, Fomin, Golovach and RaymondÂ [ref]27 proved that the XPÂ algorithms for Independent Set and Dominating Set are in a sense best possible, showing that these two problems are Wdelimited-[]1-hard when parameterized by mim-width. On the positive side, XPÂ algorithms parameterized by mim-width are now also known for problems outside the LC-VSVP framework. In particular, Jaffke, Kwon, StrÃ¸mme and TelleÂ  proved that the distance versions of LC-VSVP problems can be solved in polynomial time
for graph classes where mim-width is bounded and quickly computable.
Jaffke, Kwon and TelleÂ   proved similar results for Longest Induced Path, Induced Disjoint Paths, Hğ»H-Induced Topological Minor and Feedback Vertex Set.
The latter result has recently been generalized to Subset Feedback Vertex Set and Node Multiway Cut, by Bergougnoux, Papadopoulos and TelleÂ . Bergougnoux and KantÃ©Â [ref]2 gave a meta-algorithm for problems with a global constraint, providing unifying XPÂ algorithms in mim-width for several of the aforementioned problems, as well as Connected Dominating Set, Node Weighted Steiner Tree, and Maximum Induced Tree.
Galby, Munaro and RiesÂ  proved that Semitotal Dominating Set is polynomial-time solvable for graph classes where mim-width is bounded and quickly computable.
